page.title: 17Views of a Shropshire Vicar
page.content: The priest-in-charge of this rural community has pastoral responsibility for six churches, including those of Leebotwood, Smethcott and Woolstaston. He is concerned that the professional status of the clergy has been greatly eroded both financially and socially in recent years. He is also concerned that the church building is seen by the villagers as not simply a place of worship, but is considered to be the symbol of the village. When money is needed for church repairs other residents as well as the congregation, are willing to make contributions in order to preserve their village symbol. However, the clergyman would prefer to be seen as the spiritual leader of his parishioners rather than the Curator of Historic Monuments.
